servinfo.title: Piston, Piston Ring and Connecting Rod Removal and Installation

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Piston, Piston Ring and Connecting Rod Components:N32A

s1.ptxt: Mark cylinder number on all pistons, connecting rods and connecting rod caps using silver pencil or quick drying paint.
Remove carbon from top of cylinder bore before removing piston from cylinder.
Push out piston and connecting rod assembly through the top of cylinder bore.
Remove connecting rod bearings from connecting rod and connecting rod bearing cap, if necessary.

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Piston, Piston Ring and Connecting Rod Disassembly and Reassembly:N32A

s1.ptxt: Apply engine oil to pistons, rings, cylinder walls, new connecting rod bearings and crank pins.

attention3.ptxt: Do not apply oil between connecting rod and bearing or between bearing cap and bearing.

s1.ptxt: Install new connecting rod bearing to connecting rod bearing cap and connecting rod as follows, if removed.

s2.ptxt: Fit tab (1) of connecting rod bearing to groove (2) of connecting rod and bearing cap.
Press bearing end (3) until bearing end be comes flush with surface of connecting rod and bearing cap.

s1.ptxt: When installing piston and connecting rod assembly into cylinder bore, point front mark (1) on piston head to crankshaft pulley side.
Install piston and connecting rod assembly into cylinder bore. Use special tool (Piston ring compressor) to compress rings. Guide connecting rod into place on crankshaft.
Using a hammer handle, tap piston head to install piston into bore. Hold ring compressor firmly against cylinder block until all piston rings have entered cylinder bore.

attention2.ptxt: Do not apply engine oil to new connecting rod bolt.

attention3.ptxt: Tighten connecting rod bolt gradually till they are tightened to specified torque.

s2.ptxt: Point projection part (2) on cap to cylinder head (bank 1) side.
Tighten all connecting rod bolts to 30 N·m (3.1 kgf-m, 22.5 lbf-ft) evenly and gradually.
Loosen all bolts until loosening torque becomes 0.
In the same manner as Step a), tighten them to 25 N·m (2.5 kgf-m, 18.5 lbf-ft).
In the same manner as Step a), retighten them by 110°.
